title: University of Georgia Policy for Programs and Activities Serving Minors
summary: Policy recognizing the special duty of care when working with minors and setting forth operational requirements to enhance protection of minors in University programs and activities

key_definitions.mandatory_reporter: Any person required by Georgia law (O.C.G.A. ยง19-7-5) to report suspected child abuse. Includes faculty/teachers, administrators, counselors, social workers, psychologists, law enforcement, and others who provide care, treatment, education, training, supervision, coaching, counseling, recreational programs, or shelter to minors.
key_definitions.minor: Any person under 18 years of age (O.C.G.A. ยง39-1-1)
key_definitions.program_activity: Any academic, admissions, athletic, educational, research, service, leadership, or recreational program serving one or more minors, including camps, clinics, conferences, workshops, tutoring, mentoring, group lessons, seminars, competitions, internships, experiential learning, research activities, pre-enrollment visits, after-school programs, or enrichment opportunities
key_definitions.program_activity_administrator: Individual with primary and direct operational responsibility for overall content and execution of a program/activity; serves as primary point of contact
key_definitions.program_activity_staff: Individuals (paid, volunteer, or for academic credit) who have care, custody, control, and/or direct contact with minors. Includes administrators, faculty, staff, students, volunteers, and third parties operating programs/activities
key_definitions.third_party: Individual, organization, or entity external to the University to which the University allows facility use to operate a program/activity
key_definitions.sponsoring_unit: Any department or unit of the University that offers a program/activity
key_definitions.university_facility: Building, structure, classroom, laboratory, outdoor area, grounds, or athletic venue owned, leased, or controlled by the University, or used in connection with any program/activity

applies_to: Programs/activities offered by University departments/units at University facilities or other locations
Programs/activities offered by registered student organizations at University facilities or other locations
Programs/activities offered by third parties utilizing University facilities
does_not_apply_to: Minors enrolled in undergraduate or graduate coursework
Events where minors are supervised by parent/guardian
Events open to general public where parents/guardians provide supervision
UGA employees/students hosting family members, friends, or guests
applicability.relationship_to_other_policies: Supplements, does not replace, existing safety and security measures, policies, or codes of conduct

review_and_approval.timeline: Must be registered at least 60 days before program start date (normally)
review_and_approval.approval_required_from: Sponsoring Unit's Dean, Director, Vice President, or Department Head
review_and_approval.third_party_requirement: Must certify compliance with this policy to receive approval for facility use
considerations: Appropriate subject matter and fully planned activity itinerary
Appropriate staffing and supervision ratios (avoid one-on-one contact)
Program/Activity Staff Code of Conduct and guidelines
Minor Code of Conduct, forms, waivers, and supplemental guidelines
Program orientation and information for minors and parents
For laboratory work: Follow UGA Policy on Minors in Research Laboratories, Clinics, and Animal Facilities
Housing arrangements (special consideration for overnight programs)
Contracts for Auxiliary Services and Food Services
Safety and security planning (first aid, emergency response, notification plans, injury/illness reporting, inclement weather)

background_checks.requirement: All program/activity staff with direct contact with minors must undergo criminal background check (including sex offender registry check)
background_checks.compliance_standard: Must meet HRAP (Human Resources Administrative Practice Manual) requirements
background_checks.timing: Must have current background check clearance prior to working with minors
background_checks.coordination: Program administrators coordinate with unit HR office or University HR
background_checks.third_party_requirement: Must certify all staff have undergone background checks meeting minimum HRAP requirements
background_checks.self_reporting: Staff must self-report any arrest, charge, or criminal conviction occurring after background check date
background_checks.additional_screening: Depending on program nature, may include in-person interviews and/or reference checks

training.frequency: At minimum, completed every two years
training.documentation: Training documentation and certifications maintained by Program/Activity Administrator
required_for_all_staff_and_approving_off: Mandatory Reporting obligations, including child abuse awareness and prevention
Board of Regents Sexual Misconduct Policy
Code of Conduct for Program/Activity Staff
program_specific_training: Code of Conduct for minor participants
Reporting requirements, processes, and contacts during program/activity
Disability accommodations and evaluation of special requests
First aid guidelines and medication management
Activities, risks, and responsibilities as applicable

records_retention.minor_records: Retain for 3 years after minor reaches age 18
records_retention.compliance: Per Board of Regents policies on record retention

conduct_requirements.code_of_conduct: All minor participants and program/activity staff must agree to abide by applicable Code of Conduct and supplemental program guidelines

third_party_facility_use.requirement: Must execute a Facilities Use Agreement
third_party_facility_use.compliance: Must comply with this policy including UGA Sponsoring Unit approval, background check certification, and proper staff training
third_party_facility_use.contact: Office of Real Estate in Office of Finance and Administration for approved Facility Use Agreement

injury_reporting.purpose: Maintain safe environment for all students, faculty, staff, and visitors
injury_reporting.method: Online reporting form through Finance and Administration
injury_reporting.timing: As early as possible after injury occurs

child_abuse_mandatory_reporting.who_must_report: All program/activity staff (including volunteers) and mandatory reporters with reasonable cause to believe suspected child abuse has occurred
child_abuse_mandatory_reporting.timing: Immediately - no later than 24 hours after first having reasonable cause to suspect abuse
child_abuse_mandatory_reporting.do_not_investigate: Do not attempt to investigate or gather additional information before reporting

must_report_to_all_three.entity: Program/Activity Administrator, Supervisor, or other responsible University Official
Georgia Division of Family and Children Services

child_abuse_mandatory_reporting.clarification: Reporting is not making an accusation; it's reporting facts for trained professionals to evaluate and investigate

site_visits.purpose: Ensure compliance with policy and encourage best practices
site_visits.outcome: Feedback provided on areas of recommended improvement

violations_and_sanctions: Suspension, dismissal, or termination of University employment or program/activity staff status
Removal or barring from University facilities
accountability.university_funding: Programs/activities not approved and registered per this policy are not eligible for payment, repayment, or reimbursement by University Business & Accounting Services

policy_administration.responsible_senior_administrator: Vice President for Public Service and Outreach
policy_administration.responsible_administrator: Director, Georgia Center for Continuing Education & Hotel
policy_administration.policy_owner: Director of Compliance, Programs and Activities Serving Minors
director_of_compliance_responsibilities: Enhance compliance by Program Administrators and Approving Officials
Create additional training and engagement opportunities
Institute record retention systems for documenting compliance
Improve online registration and approval process
Ensure University engages in best practices when dealing with minors

oversight_committee.selected_from: Academic Affairs, Athletics, University Human Resources, Public Service and Outreach, Student Affairs, and 4-H
powers: Recommend appropriate actions for Program/Activity Administrators, Departments, and Units
Initiate enforcement actions against an individual or program/activity
Any other action reasonably required in furtherance of this policy

compliance_foundation: Adopted in accordance with Board of Regents Policy 6.9, Programs Serving Minors
